I have gone through the case notes and inferred the following: -

Problem Description: DNAC - Port Assignment provisioning removing radius config and reapplying the same

Symptoms:
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config)#no radius server dnac-radius_172.19.208.9
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config)#no radius server dnac-radius_172.19.208.25

E2-03-CNT-ES2(config)#radius server dnac-radius_172.19.208.9
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config-radius-server)#address ipv4 172.19.208.9 auth-port 1812 acct-port 1813
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config-radius-server)#pac key 7 ******
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config-radius-server)#retransmit 3
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config-radius-server)#timeout 4
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config-radius-server)#automate-tester username dummy ignore-acct-port probe-on
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config-radius-server)#exit
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config)#radius server dnac-radius_172.19.208.25
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config-radius-server)#address ipv4 172.19.208.25 auth-port 1812 acct-port 1813
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config-radius-server)#pac key 7 ******
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config-radius-server)#retransmit 3
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config-radius-server)#timeout 4
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config-radius-server)#automate-tester username dummy ignore-acct-port probe-on
E2-03-CNT-ES2(config-radius-server)#exit

Action Plan:

1.       Do all devices exhibit this behaviour ? What is the show run of this switch ? What are the last provisioning done for this device ?

4.       Any recent changes post which this has been observed ? Since when did this start ?

Note__c:
HA SSO - RP connection issue

Primary controller .15 WLC location HSDC - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch.
Secondary controller .14 Location TLDC  - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch

On 10th Jul, Secondary (Standby) controller went to maintenance mode due to RP communication failure
RP cable is connected through switches in between two locations (approx 5 km disatance)

Brought UP standby controller RP communication by clearing CRC errors/change cable/ switch port on TLDC location (Active) controller switch C6807-XL

Again the TLDC location (Active) controller went to Maintenance mode on same day and the APs all are gone UP to Secondary comes Active (HSDC Location) and RP communication failure, however RP port is UP.

On 12th Jul, We encountered same CRC on the switch Port (TLDC location). Clearing CRC is doesn't help.
Requested to change the SFP and RJ45 to Fiber connector between the Switch and Primary controller (TLDC) _ its looks like L1 issue between two controllers on RP connection.
2 Brand new cables have been use to replace previous cables on switch 
After change on cables and make port channel up, connection to HA SSO form correctly with no issues.

customer called stating that they did not get a webex invite from the case owner, the customer asked to raise severity and to requeue but disconnected the call before the process could be started, CO sent a webex invite again.

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi Baby John and Team,



Thank you for your time on call.



Please find the case summary below



Issue Reported:

Controller is on Maintenance Mode

Switch C6807 Port Te1/2/26 towards TLDC controller RP Port (RJ45) keeps on generating CRC errors.



As discussed on call today;

  *   Primary (Active) controller location TLDC  - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch.
Secondary (Standby) controller Location HSDC - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch

On 10th Jul, Secondary (Standby) controller went to maintenance mode due to RP communication failure. RP cable is connected through switches in between two locations (approx. 5 km disatance)
Brought UP standby controller RP communication by clearing CRC errors/change cable/ switch port on TLDC location (Active) controller switch C6807-XL

Again the TLDC location (Active) controller went to Maintenance mode on same day and the APs all are gone UP to Secondary comes Active (HSDC Location) and RP communication failure, however RP port is UP.



  *   On 12th Jul, We encountered same CRC on the switch Port (TLDC location). Clearing CRC is doesn't help.



  *   We could understand the issue is from TDLC location and it could be L1 issue between Controller RP port (RJ45) and Switch Port (C6807) TenGig interface.



Involved Switch engineer @Gourav Kumar -X (gouravku - ADECCO INDIA PRIVATE LIMITED at Cisco)<mailto:gouravku@cisco.com>



Important Note: As cisco recommended, the RP port needs to be back to back connection (direct connection)



Next Action:

  *   Need to change the Cable between RP Port (RJ45) towards Patch Panel and towards C6807 switch port (Fiber Port ) and also change switch port from Te1/2/26

The customer needs to change the GLC-TE with working one

  *   After changes if all cable checks UP, the TLDC controller needs to be rebooted, so once its comes UP with RP, all the APs will failover to TLDC (Primary controller).
  *   Once the controller RP HA-SSO UP, Please enable the below debugs on the primary controller and SSH to secondary and enable the same.

debug redundancy infra errors

debug redundancy infra events

debug redundancy transport errors

debug redundancy transport events

debug redundancy transport packet

debug redundancy keepalive errors

debug redundancy keepalive events

debug redundancy keepalive details

debug redundancy gw-reachability errors

debug redundancy gw-reachability events

debug redundancy config-sync events

debug redundancy config-sync errors

debug redundancy ap-sync errors

debug redundancy ap-sync events

debug redundancy client-sync errors

debug redundancy client-sync events

debug redundancy mobility errors

debug redundancy mobility events











Regards,

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi Baby John and Team,



Thank you for your time on call.



Please find the case summary below



Issue Reported:

Controller is on Maintenance Mode

Switch C6807 Port Te1/2/26 towards TLDC controller RP Port (RJ45) keeps on generating CRC errors.



As discussed on call today;

  *   Primary (Active) controller location TLDC  - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch.
Secondary (Standby) controller Location HSDC - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch

On 10th Jul, Secondary (Standby) controller went to maintenance mode due to RP communication failure. RP cable is connected through switches in between two locations (approx. 5 km disatance)
Brought UP standby controller RP communication by clearing CRC errors/change cable/ switch port on TLDC location (Active) controller switch C6807-XL

Again the TLDC location (Active) controller went to Maintenance mode on same day and the APs all are gone UP to Secondary comes Active (HSDC Location) and RP communication failure, however RP port is UP.



  *   On 12th Jul, We encountered same CRC on the switch Port (TLDC location). Clearing CRC is doesn't help.



  *   We could understand the issue is from TDLC location and it could be L1 issue between Controller RP port (RJ45) and Switch Port (C6807) TenGig interface.



Involved Switch engineer @Gourav Kumar -X (gouravku - ADECCO INDIA PRIVATE LIMITED at Cisco)<mailto:gouravku@cisco.com>



Important Note: As cisco recommended, the RP port needs to be back to back connection (direct connection)



Next Action:

  *   Need to change the Cable between RP Port (RJ45) towards Patch Panel and towards C6807 switch port (Fiber Port ) and also change switch port from Te1/2/26

The customer needs to change the GLC-TE with working one

  *   After changes if all cable checks UP, the TLDC controller needs to be rebooted, so once its comes UP with RP, all the APs will failover to TLDC (Primary controller).
  *   Once the controller RP HA-SSO UP, Please enable the below debugs on the primary controller and SSH to secondary and enable the same.

debug redundancy infra errors

debug redundancy infra events

debug redundancy transport errors

debug redundancy transport events

debug redundancy transport packet

debug redundancy keepalive errors

debug redundancy keepalive events

debug redundancy keepalive details

debug redundancy gw-reachability errors

debug redundancy gw-reachability events

debug redundancy config-sync events

debug redundancy config-sync errors

debug redundancy ap-sync errors

debug redundancy ap-sync events

debug redundancy client-sync errors

debug redundancy client-sync events

debug redundancy mobility errors

debug redundancy mobility events











Regards,

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode


- External Email -



Hi Baby John and Team,



Thank you for your time on call.



Please find the case summary below



Issue Reported:

Controller is on Maintenance Mode

Switch C6807 Port Te1/2/26 towards TLDC controller RP Port (RJ45) keeps on generating CRC errors.



As discussed on call today;

  *   Primary (Active) controller location TLDC  - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch.
Secondary (Standby) controller Location HSDC - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch

On 10th Jul, Secondary (Standby) controller went to maintenance mode due to RP communication failure. RP cable is connected through switches in between two locations (approx. 5 km disatance)
Brought UP standby controller RP communication by clearing CRC errors/change cable/ switch port on TLDC location (Active) controller switch C6807-XL

Again the TLDC location (Active) controller went to Maintenance mode on same day and the APs all are gone UP to Secondary comes Active (HSDC Location) and RP communication failure, however RP port is UP.



  *   On 12th Jul, We encountered same CRC on the switch Port (TLDC location). Clearing CRC is doesn't help.



  *   We could understand the issue is from TDLC location and it could be L1 issue between Controller RP port (RJ45) and Switch Port (C6807) TenGig interface.



Involved Switch engineer @Gourav Kumar -X (gouravku - ADECCO INDIA PRIVATE LIMITED at Cisco)<mailto:gouravku@cisco.com>



Important Note: As cisco recommended, the RP port needs to be back to back connection (direct connection)



Next Action:

  *   Need to change the Cable between RP Port (RJ45) towards Patch Panel and towards C6807 switch port (Fiber Port ) and also change switch port from Te1/2/26

The customer needs to change the GLC-TE with working one

  *   After changes if all cable checks UP, the TLDC controller needs to be rebooted, so once its comes UP with RP, all the APs will failover to TLDC (Primary controller).
  *   Once the controller RP HA-SSO UP, Please enable the below debugs on the primary controller and SSH to secondary and enable the same.

debug redundancy infra errors

debug redundancy infra events

debug redundancy transport errors

debug redundancy transport events

debug redundancy transport packet

debug redundancy keepalive errors

debug redundancy keepalive events

debug redundancy keepalive details

debug redundancy gw-reachability errors

debug redundancy gw-reachability events

debug redundancy config-sync events

debug redundancy config-sync errors

debug redundancy ap-sync errors

debug redundancy ap-sync events

debug redundancy client-sync errors

debug redundancy client-sync events

debug redundancy mobility errors

debug redundancy mobility events











Regards,

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode

        - External Email -



Hi Baby John and Team,



Thank you for your time on call.



Please find the case summary below



Issue Reported:

Controller is on Maintenance Mode

Switch C6807 Port Te1/2/26 towards TLDC controller RP Port (RJ45) keeps on generating CRC errors.



As discussed on call today;

  *   Primary (Active) controller location TLDC  - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch.
Secondary (Standby) controller Location HSDC - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch

On 10th Jul, Secondary (Standby) controller went to maintenance mode due to RP communication failure. RP cable is connected through switches in between two locations (approx. 5 km disatance)
Brought UP standby controller RP communication by clearing CRC errors/change cable/ switch port on TLDC location (Active) controller switch C6807-XL

Again the TLDC location (Active) controller went to Maintenance mode on same day and the APs all are gone UP to Secondary comes Active (HSDC Location) and RP communication failure, however RP port is UP.



  *   On 12th Jul, We encountered same CRC on the switch Port (TLDC location). Clearing CRC is doesn't help.



  *   We could understand the issue is from TDLC location and it could be L1 issue between Controller RP port (RJ45) and Switch Port (C6807) TenGig interface.



Involved Switch engineer @Gourav Kumar -X (gouravku - ADECCO INDIA PRIVATE LIMITED at Cisco)<mailto:gouravku@cisco.com>



Important Note: As cisco recommended, the RP port needs to be back to back connection (direct connection)



Next Action:

  *   Need to change the Cable between RP Port (RJ45) towards Patch Panel and towards C6807 switch port (Fiber Port ) and also change switch port from Te1/2/26

The customer needs to change the GLC-TE with working one

  *   After changes if all cable checks UP, the TLDC controller needs to be rebooted, so once its comes UP with RP, all the APs will failover to TLDC (Primary controller).
  *   Once the controller RP HA-SSO UP, Please enable the below debugs on the primary controller and SSH to secondary and enable the same.

debug redundancy infra errors

debug redundancy infra events

debug redundancy transport errors

debug redundancy transport events

debug redundancy transport packet

debug redundancy keepalive errors

debug redundancy keepalive events

debug redundancy keepalive details

debug redundancy gw-reachability errors

debug redundancy gw-reachability events

debug redundancy config-sync events

debug redundancy config-sync errors

debug redundancy ap-sync errors

debug redundancy ap-sync events

debug redundancy client-sync errors

debug redundancy client-sync events

debug redundancy mobility errors

debug redundancy mobility events











Regards,

Yokeswaran Yohadhandan

Technical Consulting Engineer

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode

Hi Baby John and Team,

Thank you for your time on call.

Please find the case summary below

Issue Reported:
Controller is on Maintenance Mode
Switch C6807 Port Te1/2/26 towards TLDC controller RP Port (RJ45) keeps on generating CRC errors.

As discussed on call today;

  *   Primary (Active) controller location TLDC  - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch.
Secondary (Standby) controller Location HSDC - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch

On 10th Jul, Secondary (Standby) controller went to maintenance mode due to RP communication failure. RP cable is connected through switches in between two locations (approx. 5 km disatance)
Brought UP standby controller RP communication by clearing CRC errors/change cable/ switch port on TLDC location (Active) controller switch C6807-XL

Again the TLDC location (Active) controller went to Maintenance mode on same day and the APs all are gone UP to Secondary comes Active (HSDC Location) and RP communication failure, however RP port is UP.


  *   On 12th Jul, We encountered same CRC on the switch Port (TLDC location). Clearing CRC is doesn't help.


  *   We could understand the issue is from TDLC location and it could be L1 issue between Controller RP port (RJ45) and Switch Port (C6807) TenGig interface.

Involved Switch engineer @Gourav Kumar -X (gouravku - ADECCO INDIA PRIVATE LIMITED at Cisco)<mailto:gouravku@cisco.com>

Important Note: As cisco recommended, the RP port needs to be back to back connection (direct connection)

Next Action:

  *   Need to change the Cable between RP Port (RJ45) towards Patch Panel and towards C6807 switch port (Fiber Port ) and also change switch port from Te1/2/26

The customer needs to change the GLC-TE with working one

  *   After changes if all cable checks UP, the TLDC controller needs to be rebooted, so once its comes UP with RP, all the APs will failover to TLDC (Primary controller).
  *   Once the controller RP HA-SSO UP, Please enable the below debugs on the primary controller and SSH to secondary and enable the same.

debug redundancy infra errors

debug redundancy infra events

debug redundancy transport errors

debug redundancy transport events

debug redundancy transport packet

debug redundancy keepalive errors

debug redundancy keepalive events

debug redundancy keepalive details

debug redundancy gw-reachability errors

debug redundancy gw-reachability events

debug redundancy config-sync events

debug redundancy config-sync errors

debug redundancy ap-sync errors

debug redundancy ap-sync events

debug redundancy client-sync errors

debug redundancy client-sync events

debug redundancy mobility errors

debug redundancy mobility events





Regards,
Yokeswaran Yohadhandan
Technical Consulting Engineer

extracted_note:
Hi Baby John and Team,
Thank you for your time on call.
Please find the case summary below
Issue Reported:
Controller is on Maintenance Mode
Switch C6807 Port Te1/2/26 towards TLDC controller RP Port (RJ45) keeps on generating CRC errors.
As discussed on call today;
*   Primary (Active) controller location TLDC  - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch.
Secondary (Standby) controller Location HSDC - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch
On 10th Jul, Secondary (Standby) controller went to maintenance mode due to RP communication failure.
RP cable is connected through switches in between two locations (approx.
5 km disatance)
Brought UP standby controller RP communication by clearing CRC errors/change cable/ switch port on TLDC location (Active) controller switch C6807-XL
Again the TLDC location (Active) controller went to Maintenance mode on same day and the APs all are gone UP to Secondary comes Active (HSDC Location) and RP communication failure, however RP port is UP.
*   On 12th Jul, We encountered same CRC on the switch Port (TLDC location).
Clearing CRC is doesn't help.
*   We could understand the issue is from TDLC location and it could be L1 issue between Controller RP port (RJ45) and Switch Port (C6807) TenGig interface.
Involved Switch engineer @Gourav Kumar -X (gouravku - ADECCO INDIA PRIVATE LIMITED at Cisco)<mailto:gouravku@cisco.com>
Important Note: As cisco recommended, the RP port needs to be back to back connection (direct connection)
Next Action:
*   Need to change the Cable between RP Port (RJ45) towards Patch Panel and towards C6807 switch port (Fiber Port ) and also change switch port from Te1/2/26
The customer needs to change the GLC-TE with working one
*   After changes if all cable checks UP, the TLDC controller needs to be rebooted, so once its comes UP with RP, all the APs will failover to TLDC (Primary controller).
*   Once the controller RP HA-SSO UP, Please enable the below debugs on the primary controller and SSH to secondary and enable the same.
debug redundancy infra errors
debug redundancy infra events
debug redundancy transport errors
debug redundancy transport events
debug redundancy transport packet
debug redundancy keepalive errors
debug redundancy keepalive events
debug redundancy keepalive details
debug redundancy gw-reachability errors
debug redundancy gw-reachability events
debug redundancy config-sync events
debug redundancy config-sync errors
debug redundancy ap-sync errors
debug redundancy ap-sync events
debug redundancy client-sync errors
debug redundancy client-sync events
debug redundancy mobility errors
debug redundancy mobility events

Note__c:
HA SSO - RP connection issue

Primary (Active) controller location TLDC - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch
Secondary (Standby) controller Location HSDC - Connected to C6807-XL (6T) switch

On 10th Jul, Secondary (Standby) controller went to maintenance mode due to RP communication failure
RP cable is connected through switches in between two locations (approx 5 km disatance)

Brought UP standby controller RP communication by clearing CRC errors/change cable/ switch port on TLDC location (Active) controller switch C6807-XL

Again the TLDC location (Active) controller went to Maintenance mode on same day and the APs all are gone UP to Secondary comes Active (HSDC Location) and RP communication failure, however RP port is UP.

On 12th Jul, We encountered same CRC on the switch Port (TLDC location). Clearing CRC is doesn't help.
Requested to change the SFP and RJ45 to Fiber connector between the Switch and Primary controller (TLDC) _ its looks like L1 issue between two controllers on RP connection.

extracted_note: Attached is the console log file collected from TLDC WLC01 (.14 wlc) currently in maintenace mode.

Note__c:
need help from sw team, to investigate te CRC errors seen . on the interfaces used by RP
same errors are seen even after modules are switched.

Next Plan of Action:

For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action

Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;


  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.

Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E

----------------------------------------
Current Summary:
> Customer explained about the previous issues being faced.
> As per Baby John, today the Active WLC was in split brain state and it went into Maintenance mode.
> Both the WLCs were into Active state and to isolate the issue they have to shut down the Uplink port.

Technician is on the way to Data Center to provide the Console access, customer would like to continue the troubleshooting to find out the root cause.

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi NCS and Baby Team,



Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.



Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:



Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.



Summary:

Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)

Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below



Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)

Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023

Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d



Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------

*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer

Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..



The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.



As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.

As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.

Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8-7%2fHigh_Availability_DG.html%23pgfId-91515&umid=1c15549f-c04b-4a3f-8e13-e0a91de10c6b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-1f6851ac8e49ab5a6643c26885b566fb9b969e84>



As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.



Next Plan of Action:



For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action



Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;



  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.



Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8-1%2f8540-WLC-DG%2fb_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html%23concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E&umid=1c15549f-c04b-4a3f-8e13-e0a91de10c6b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-dd67de06d2725094f39e2511ff75fa9dfe951bec>

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi NCS and Baby Team,



Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.



Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:



Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.



Summary:

Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)

Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below



Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)

Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023

Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d



Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------

*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer

Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..



The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.



As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.

As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.

Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8-7%2fHigh_Availability_DG.html%23pgfId-91515&umid=1c15549f-c04b-4a3f-8e13-e0a91de10c6b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-1f6851ac8e49ab5a6643c26885b566fb9b969e84>



As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.



Next Plan of Action:



For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action



Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;



  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.



Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8-1%2f8540-WLC-DG%2fb_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html%23concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E&umid=1c15549f-c04b-4a3f-8e13-e0a91de10c6b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-dd67de06d2725094f39e2511ff75fa9dfe951bec>

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi NCS and Baby Team,



Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.



Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:



Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.



Summary:

Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)

Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below



Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)

Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023

Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d



Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------

*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer

Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..



The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.



As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.

As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.

Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d7%2fHigh%5fAvailability%5fDG.html%23pgfId%2d91515&umid=1c15549f-c04b-4a3f-8e13-e0a91de10c6b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-1f6851ac8e49ab5a6643c26885b566fb9b969e84>



As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.



Next Plan of Action:



For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action



Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;



  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.



Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d1%2f8540%2dWLC%2dDG%2fb%5fCisco%2d8540%2dWLC%2ddeployment%2dguide.html%23concept%5fC0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E&umid=1c15549f-c04b-4a3f-8e13-e0a91de10c6b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-dd67de06d2725094f39e2511ff75fa9dfe951bec>

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi NCS and Baby Team,



Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.



Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:



Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.



Summary:

Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)

Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below



Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)

Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023

Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d



Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------

*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer

Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..



The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.



As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.

As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.

Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8-7%2fHigh_Availability_DG.html%23pgfId-91515&umid=1c15549f-c04b-4a3f-8e13-e0a91de10c6b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-1f6851ac8e49ab5a6643c26885b566fb9b969e84>



As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.



Next Plan of Action:



For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action



Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;



  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.



Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8-1%2f8540-WLC-DG%2fb_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html%23concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E&umid=1c15549f-c04b-4a3f-8e13-e0a91de10c6b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-dd67de06d2725094f39e2511ff75fa9dfe951bec>

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi NCS and Baby Team,



Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.



Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:



Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.



Summary:

Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)

Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below



Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)

Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023

Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d



Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------

*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer

Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..



The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.



As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.

As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.

Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d7%2fHigh%5fAvailability%5fDG.html%23pgfId%2d91515&umid=1c15549f-c04b-4a3f-8e13-e0a91de10c6b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-1f6851ac8e49ab5a6643c26885b566fb9b969e84>



As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.



Next Plan of Action:



For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action



Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;



  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.



Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d1%2f8540%2dWLC%2dDG%2fb%5fCisco%2d8540%2dWLC%2ddeployment%2dguide.html%23concept%5fC0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E&umid=1c15549f-c04b-4a3f-8e13-e0a91de10c6b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-dd67de06d2725094f39e2511ff75fa9dfe951bec>

Note__c:
# Problem Description:HA SSO not form between 2 WLCs 8540

# Troubleshooting done:

Joined webex meeting with customer
Checked on HA status and customer had 1 WLC in SSO enabled as a secondary active
Then had another one as primary but not active and with SSO disabled
When customer tries to form the HA the following error logs shows:
Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..
*rmgrMain: Jul 11 22:18:14.192:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer
Issue is on the connectivity side since the WLC cannot find its peer, the switch was not forwarding the packets from the inactive WLC to the active one
Customer connected a laptop and was not able to ping the WLC, they checked on the current bandwidth and found that it was just 10Mbps in a gigabit port
Customer move the WLC to another gigabit port and now they were getting 1000 Mbps of bandwidth
Once the change was done the HA SSO was formed and the 2 WLCs formed the link
Customer agreed to lower the severity and will monitor for this week to see if the issue is totally fixed after this change
Customer will need to monitor the switch and look for this issue on their side to clear the congestion on that specific port

# Logs, error messages or inputs grabbed: console and debug logs

# Analysis:

Switchport with insufficient bandwidth required to form the HA SSO synchronization between the 2 WLCs over a VSS switch on 2 data centers

# Next steps or action to be taken:
Follow up with customer to get closure confirmation after monitoring

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi NCS and Baby Team,



Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.



Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:



Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.



Summary:

Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)

Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below



Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)

Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023

Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d



Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------

*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer

Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..



The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.



As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.

As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.

Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d7%2fHigh%5fAvailability%5fDG.html%23pgfId%2d91515&umid=1c15549f-c04b-4a3f-8e13-e0a91de10c6b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-1f6851ac8e49ab5a6643c26885b566fb9b969e84>



As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.



Next Plan of Action:



For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action



Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;



  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.



Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d1%2f8540%2dWLC%2dDG%2fb%5fCisco%2d8540%2dWLC%2ddeployment%2dguide.html%23concept%5fC0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E&umid=1c15549f-c04b-4a3f-8e13-e0a91de10c6b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-dd67de06d2725094f39e2511ff75fa9dfe951bec>

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi NCS and Baby Team,



Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.



Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:



Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.



Summary:

Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)

Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below



Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)

Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023

Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d



Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------

*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer

Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..



The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.



As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.

As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.

Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8-7%2fHigh_Availability_DG.html%23pgfId-91515&umid=f3b436f1-6cbb-491d-9737-b4201a92321c&auth=8d3ccd473d52f326e51c0f75cb32c9541898e5d5-1e36697db9b7bfc785aee6381659852a03ee93ef>



As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.



Next Plan of Action:



For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action



Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;



  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.



Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8-1%2f8540-WLC-DG%2fb_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html%23concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E&umid=f3b436f1-6cbb-491d-9737-b4201a92321c&auth=8d3ccd473d52f326e51c0f75cb32c9541898e5d5-1ec24008f48fd80f6c22e9574f3de5a21da90394>

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi NCS and Baby Team,



Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.



Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:



Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.



Summary:

Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)

Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below



Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)

Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023

Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d



Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------

*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer

Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..



The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.



As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.

As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.

Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d7%2fHigh%5fAvailability%5fDG.html%23pgfId%2d91515&umid=f3b436f1-6cbb-491d-9737-b4201a92321c&auth=8d3ccd473d52f326e51c0f75cb32c9541898e5d5-1e36697db9b7bfc785aee6381659852a03ee93ef>



As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.



Next Plan of Action:



For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action



Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;



  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.



Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d1%2f8540%2dWLC%2dDG%2fb%5fCisco%2d8540%2dWLC%2ddeployment%2dguide.html%23concept%5fC0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E&umid=f3b436f1-6cbb-491d-9737-b4201a92321c&auth=8d3ccd473d52f326e51c0f75cb32c9541898e5d5-1ec24008f48fd80f6c22e9574f3de5a21da90394>

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi NCS and Baby Team,



Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.



Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:



Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.



Summary:

Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)

Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below



Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)

Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023

Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d



Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------

*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer

Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..



The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.



As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.

As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.

Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8-7%2fHigh_Availability_DG.html%23pgfId-91515&umid=f3b436f1-6cbb-491d-9737-b4201a92321c&auth=8d3ccd473d52f326e51c0f75cb32c9541898e5d5-1e36697db9b7bfc785aee6381659852a03ee93ef>



As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.



Next Plan of Action:



For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action



Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;



  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.



Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8-1%2f8540-WLC-DG%2fb_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html%23concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E&umid=f3b436f1-6cbb-491d-9737-b4201a92321c&auth=8d3ccd473d52f326e51c0f75cb32c9541898e5d5-1ec24008f48fd80f6c22e9574f3de5a21da90394>

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi NCS and Baby Team,



Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.



Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:



Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.



Summary:

Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)

Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below



Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)

Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023

Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d



Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------

*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer

Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..



The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.



As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.

As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.

Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d7%2fHigh%5fAvailability%5fDG.html%23pgfId%2d91515&umid=f3b436f1-6cbb-491d-9737-b4201a92321c&auth=8d3ccd473d52f326e51c0f75cb32c9541898e5d5-1e36697db9b7bfc785aee6381659852a03ee93ef>



As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.



Next Plan of Action:



For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action



Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;



  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.



Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d1%2f8540%2dWLC%2dDG%2fb%5fCisco%2d8540%2dWLC%2ddeployment%2dguide.html%23concept%5fC0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E&umid=f3b436f1-6cbb-491d-9737-b4201a92321c&auth=8d3ccd473d52f326e51c0f75cb32c9541898e5d5-1ec24008f48fd80f6c22e9574f3de5a21da90394>

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi NCS and Baby Team,



Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.



Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:



Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.



Summary:

Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)

Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below



Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)

Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023

Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d



Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------

*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer

Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..



The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.



As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.

As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.

Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d7%2fHigh%5fAvailability%5fDG.html%23pgfId%2d91515&umid=75214f37-c701-4956-a956-593777955e9b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-7c31b21a2b3deee725316f364a7da2bf69aa9afb>



As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.



Next Plan of Action:



For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action



Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;



  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.



Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d1%2f8540%2dWLC%2dDG%2fb%5fCisco%2d8540%2dWLC%2ddeployment%2dguide.html%23concept%5fC0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E&umid=75214f37-c701-4956-a956-593777955e9b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-76824c8d9d1b18d364b0b27853034d10e8cbbc06>

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode





- External Email -



Hi NCS and Baby Team,



Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.



Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:



Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.



Summary:

Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)

Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below



Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)

Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023

Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d



Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------

*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer

Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..



The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.



As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.

As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.

Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d7%2fHigh%5fAvailability%5fDG.html%23pgfId%2d91515&umid=75214f37-c701-4956-a956-593777955e9b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-7c31b21a2b3deee725316f364a7da2bf69aa9afb>



As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.



Next Plan of Action:



For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action



Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;



  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.



Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d1%2f8540%2dWLC%2dDG%2fb%5fCisco%2d8540%2dWLC%2ddeployment%2dguide.html%23concept%5fC0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E&umid=75214f37-c701-4956-a956-593777955e9b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-76824c8d9d1b18d364b0b27853034d10e8cbbc06>

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode


- External Email -


Hi NCS and Baby Team,

Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.

Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:

Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.

Summary:
Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)
Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below

Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)
Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023
Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT
Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE
Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------
*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer
Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..

The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.

As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.
As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.
Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d7%2fHigh%5fAvailability%5fDG.html%23pgfId%2d91515&umid=75214f37-c701-4956-a956-593777955e9b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-7c31b21a2b3deee725316f364a7da2bf69aa9afb>

As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.

Next Plan of Action:

For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action

Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;


  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.

Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E<https://ddec1-0-en-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cisco.com%2fc%2fen%2fus%2ftd%2fdocs%2fwireless%2fcontroller%2ftechnotes%2f8%2d1%2f8540%2dWLC%2dDG%2fb%5fCisco%2d8540%2dWLC%2ddeployment%2dguide.html%23concept%5fC0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E&umid=75214f37-c701-4956-a956-593777955e9b&auth=32813f2e647ebb91b39d0b35ac97db1efa82dd64-76824c8d9d1b18d364b0b27853034d10e8cbbc06>

Subject: Re: SR 695816345 : AIR-CT8540-K9 Issue – standby controller got disconnected and we discover that it went to maintenance mode

Hi NCS and Baby Team,

Thank you for your time on call. As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.

Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:

Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.

Summary:
Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)
Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below

Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)
Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023
Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d

Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT
Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE
Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------
*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer
Role Negotiation timeout. Didn't find Peer..

The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.

As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.
As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.
Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515

As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.

Next Plan of Action:

For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action

Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;


  1.  Need to bring down the RP Port
  2.  Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
  3.  Disable the port connection and HA SSO
  4.  Reload the standby controller
  5.  Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
  6.  Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
  7.  If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
  8.  Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.

Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E

extracted_note:
Hi NCS and Baby Team,
Thank you for your time on call.
As per you request, we are keeping this case under S2 for now.
Please find the summary of the call and the next action below:
Issue Reported: The standby controller gone to “Maintenance” Mode.
Summary:
Observed that the standby controller is on Maintenance mode (CT8540 - 8.10.183.0)
Analysed the logs and found that the standby controller sync failed and timeout for the XML config and result in the Cert Failed aswell as below
Reset reason : Certificate transfer from Active to Standby failed ,(Version: 8.10.183.0)
Reset time   : Mon Jul 10 09:28:41 2023
Trace back   : 0x8f9abc 0x1e2f80a 0x1eb54d4 0x1eaacf4 0x1eaa4a6 0x1ea0413 0x1e38647 0x7dff 0xe898d
Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Previous State: RED_XML_TRANSFER_FAILED_STATE, Event:RED_XML_TRANSFER_MASTER_TMOUT_SM_EVENT
Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :Current State RED_XML_TRANSFER_DONE_STATE
Jul 10 15:40:16.800 :----------------------------------------------------------------
*rmgrMain: Jul 10 15:40:16.828:  Send Role Negotiation payload to peer
Role Negotiation timeout.
Didn't find Peer..
The above logs indicates, the issue could be from the Redundant Port connection between Active and Standby so the result in XML file sync up failed and Master timeout.
As per the information on call, the Redundant Port is not back to back connection and the connection on through distributed switches.
As per the recommendation from Cisco , the RP connection needs to be connected directly between two controllers as a permanent solution.
Please Refer > https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-7/High_Availability_DG.html#pgfId-91515
As you have provided the bug CSCvq95397, it is also related to RP connection issue and it was on Unreproduceable state due to the RP connection is not back to back.
Next Plan of Action:
For time being, if the RP connection is coming UP and there is a proper RP communication, Please try the following action
Please bring down the RP port before doing the below action;
1.
Need to bring down the RP Port
2.
Make the reachability to mgmt IP address for Standby controller (Unique IP)
3.
Disable the port connection and HA SSO
4.
Reload the standby controller
5.
Bring UP the standby as standalone controller.
6.
Reconfigure the HA SSO with RP interface UP.
7.
If the above steps are failed, Please change the switch port of RP connection.
8.
Permanent solution to connect RP back to Back.
Please refer the below document for configuration and scenario;
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-1/8540-WLC-DG/b_Cisco-8540-WLC-deployment-guide.html#concept_C0A18A765999461BA204F8BEF444D71E

Hi Team,



I’m Yokeswaran from Cisco Wireless TAC and I have taken the ownership of the case.



I could understand that the standby controller CT8540 went to maintenance mode.



Are we able to take console access to the standby controller?

Is there any service impact during the time of you have observed the issue?

May I know what is the software version running on the controllers?

May I know total number of APs working on the active?

I hope now the standby controller is on standalone mode, can we take the console to the controller and take the below output?

May I know what is the LED light status of the standby chassis?



Please provide us with the following command output from the standby controller;



>show tech support

>show interface summary

>show redundancy details

>show port status

>show logging config-history

>show running-config



If it has stuck on bootlog; Please lets have a console and reboot and log the session and send the logs to us to analyse further.



Please let me know if there is any challenges, we can schedule a Webex and troublshoot the issue.





Regards,

Yokeswaran Yohadhandan

________________________________

Hi Team,



I’m Yokeswaran from Cisco Wireless TAC and I have taken the ownership of the case.



I could understand that the standby controller CT8540 went to maintenance mode.



Are we able to take console access to the standby controller?

Is there any service impact during the time of you have observed the issue?

May I know what is the software version running on the controllers?

May I know total number of APs working on the active?

I hope now the standby controller is on standalone mode, can we take the console to the controller and take the below output?

May I know what is the LED light status of the standby chassis?



Please provide us with the following command output from the standby controller;



>show tech support

>show interface summary

>show redundancy details

>show port status

>show logging config-history

>show running-config



If it has stuck on bootlog; Please lets have a console and reboot and log the session and send the logs to us to analyse further.



Please let me know if there is any challenges, we can schedule a Webex and troublshoot the issue.





Regards,

Yokeswaran Yohadhandan

Hi Team,



I’m Yokeswaran from Cisco Wireless TAC and I have taken the ownership of the case.



I could understand that the standby controller CT8540 went to maintenance mode.



Are we able to take console access to the standby controller?

Is there any service impact during the time of you have observed the issue?

May I know what is the software version running on the controllers?

May I know total number of APs working on the active?

I hope now the standby controller is on standalone mode, can we take the console to the controller and take the below output?

May I know what is the LED light status of the standby chassis?



Please provide us with the following command output from the standby controller;



>show tech support

>show interface summary

>show redundancy details

>show port status

>show logging config-history

>show running-config



If it has stuck on bootlog; Please lets have a console and reboot and log the session and send the logs to us to analyse further.



Please let me know if there is any challenges, we can schedule a Webex and troublshoot the issue.
